string-array.name: pokemon_desc
string-array.item: Bulbasaur can be seen napping in bright sunlight. By soaking up the sun\'s rays, the seed in his back grows progressively larger.
There is a bud on this Pokémon\'s back. To support its weight, Ivysaur\'s legs and trunk grow thick and strong.
There is a large flower on Venusaur\'s back.The flower is said to take on vivid colors if it gets plenty of nutrition and sunlight
The flame that burns at the tip of its tail is an indication of its emotions. The flame wavers when Charmander is enjoying itself
Charmeleon mercilessly destroys its foes using its sharp claws. If it encounters a strong foe, it turns aggressive.
Charizard flies around the sky in search of powerful opponents. It breathes fire of such great heat that it melts anything.
Squirtle\'s shell is not merely used for protection. The shell\'s rounded shape help minimize resistance in water.
Its tail is large and covered with a rich, thick fur. The tail becomes increasingly deeper in color as Wartortle ages.
Blastoise has water spouts that protrude from its shell. The water spouts are very accurate over 60 feet.
Caterpie has a voracious appetite. It can devour leaves bigger than its body right before your eyes.
The shell covering this Pokémon\'s body is as hard as an iron slab. Metapod does not move very much
Butterfree has a superior ability to search for delicious honey from flowers.
It is capable of distinguishing its favorite kinds of leaves from those it dislikes just by sniffing with its big red proboscis.
Kakuna remains virtually immobile as it clings to a tree. It is extremely busy as it prepares for its coming evolution.
Beedrill is extremely territorial. No one should ever approach its nestthis is for their own safety.
It is capable of unerringly returning home to its nest, however far it may be removed from its familiar surroundings.
Pidgeotto claims a large area as its own territory. This Pokémon flies around, patrolling its living space.
Trainers are captivated by the striking beauty of the feathers on its head, compelling them to choose Pidgeot as their Pokémon.
Rattata is cautious in the extreme. Even while it is asleep, it constantly listens by moving its ears around.
Raticate\'s sturdy fangs grow steadily. To keep them ground down, it gnaws on rocks and logs.
Spearow has a very loud cry that can be heard over half a mile away.
Fearow is recognized by its long neck and elongated beak. They are conveniently shaped for catching prey in soil or water.
Assuming this position allows it to quickly respond to a threat from any direction with a glare from its upraised head.
This Pokémon is terrifically strong in order to constrict things with its body. It can even flatten steel oil drums.
Whenever Pikachu comes across something new, it blasts it with a jolt of electricity.
If the electrical sacs become excessively charged, Raichu plants its tail in the ground and discharges.
Sandshrew\'s body is configured to absorb water without waste, enabling it to survive in an arid desert.
Sandslash\'s body is covered by tough spikes, which are hardened sections of its hide.
Nidoran F has barbs that secrete a powerful poison. They are thought to have developed as protection for this small-bodied Pokémon
When Nidorina are with their friends or family, they keep their barbs tucked away to prevent hurting each other.
Nidoqueen\'s body is encased in extremely hard scales. It is adept at sending foes flying with harsh tackles.
Nidoran M has developed muscles for moving its ears. Thanks to them, the ears can be freely moved in any direction.
If it senses a hostile presence, all the barbs on its back bristle up at once, and it challenges the foe with all its might.
Nidoking\'s thick tail packs enormously destructive power. With one swing, it can topple a metal transmission tower.
On every night of a full moon, groups of this Pokémon come out to play.
Clefable moves by skipping lightly as if it were flying using its wings. Its bouncy step lets it even walk on water.
The tail separates into six if this Pokémon receives plenty of love from its Trainer. The six tails become magnificently curled.
Ninetales casts a sinister light from its bright red eyes to gain total control over its foe\'s mind.
Jigglypuff\'s vocal cords can freely adjust the wavelength of its voice.
Wigglytuff has large, saucerlike eyes. The surfaces of its eyes are always covered with a thin layer of tears.
Zubat remains quietly unmoving in a dark spot during the bright daylight hours.
Golbat loves to drink the blood of living things. It is particularly active in the pitch black of night.
During the daytime, Oddish buries itself in soil to absorb nutrients from the ground using its entire body.
Gloom releases a foul fragrance from the pistil of its flower. When faced with danger, the stench worsens.
Vileplume\'s toxic pollen triggers atrocious allergy attacks.
Paras has parasitic mushrooms growing on its back called tochukaso. They grow large by drawing nutrients from this Bug host.
Parasect is known to infest large trees en masse and drain nutrients from the lower trunk and roots.
Venonat is said to have evolved with a coat of thin, stiff hair that covers its entire body for protection.
Venomoth is nocturnalit is a Pokémon that only becomes active at night.
Diglett are raised in most farms.The reason is wherever this Pokémon burrows,the soil is left perfectly tilled for planting crops
Dugtrio are actually triplets that emerged from one body.
Meowth withdraws its sharp claws into its paws to slinkily sneak about without making any incriminating footsteps.
Persian has six bold whiskers that give it a look of toughness.
Psyduck uses a mysterious power. When it does so, this Pokémon generates brain waves that are supposedly only seen in sleepers.
The webbed flippers on its forelegs and hind legs and the streamlined body of Golduck give it frightening speed.
When Mankey starts shaking and its nasal breathing turns rough, it\'s a sure sign that it is becoming angry.
When Primeape becomes furious, its blood circulation is boosted. In turn, its muscles are made even stronger.
Growlithe has a superb sense of smell. Once it smells anything, this Pokémon won\'t forget the scent, no matter what.
Arcanine is known for its high speed. It is said to be capable of running over 6,200 miles in a single day and night.
Poliwag has a very thin skin. It is possible to see the Pokémon\'s spiral innards right through the skin.
The surface of Poliwhirl\'s body is always wet and slick with a slimy fluid.
Poliwrath\'s highly developed, brawny muscles never grow fatigued, however much it exercises.
Abra sleeps for eighteen hours a day. However, it can sense the presence of foes even while it is sleeping.
Kadabra emits a peculiar alpha wave if it develops a headache.
Alakazam\'s brain continually grows, making its head far too heavy to support with its neck.
Machop\'s muscles are specialthey never get sore no matter how much they are used in exercise.
Machoke\'s thoroughly toned muscles possess the hardness of steel.
Machamp has the power to hurl anything aside. However its arms can get easily entangled.
Bellsprout\'s thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway to avoid any attack, however strong it may be.
Weepinbell has a large hook on its rear end. At night, the Pokémon hooks on to a tree branch and goes to sleep.
Victreebel has a long vine that extends from its head and it is waved and flicked about as if it were an animal to attract prey.
Tentacool\'s body is largely composed of water. If it is removed from the sea, it dries up like parchment.
Tentacruel has large red orbs on its head. The orbs glow before lashing the vicinity with a harsh ultrasonic blast.
The longer a Geodude lives, the more its edges are chipped and worn away, making it more rounded in appearance.
Graveler grows by feeding on rocks. Apparently, it prefers to eat rocks that are covered in moss.
If there is a large earthquake, these Pokémon will come rolling down off the mountains en masse to the foothills below.
Ponyta is very weak at birth. It can barely stand up. This Pokémon becomes stronger by stumbling.
Rapidash usually can be seen casually cantering in the fields and plains.
Slowpoke uses its tail to catch prey by dipping it in water at the side of a river.
Slowbro\'s tail has a Shellder firmly attached with a bite. As a result, the tail can\'t be used for fishing anymore.
Magnemite attaches itself to power lines to feed on electricity.
Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to mechanical devices.
Farfetch\'d is always seen with a stalk from a plant of some sort.
Doduo\'s two heads never sleep at the same time. Its two heads take turns sleeping, so one head can always keep watch .
Watch out if Dodrio\'s three heads are looking in three separate directions.
Seel hunts for prey in the frigid sea underneath sheets of ice.
The sight of this Pokémon sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought to be a mermaid by a mariner long ago.
Grimer\'s sludgy and rubbery body can be forced through any opening, however small it may be.
From Muk\'s body seeps a foul fluid that gives off a nose-bendingly horrible stench.
At night, this Pokémon uses its broad tongue to burrow a hole in the seafloor sand and then sleep in it.
Cloyster is capable of swimming in the sea. It does so by swallowing water, then jetting it out toward the rear.
Gastly is largely composed of gaseous matter. When exposed to a strong wind, the gaseous body quickly dwindles away.
Haunter is a dangerous Pokémon. If one beckons you while floating in darkness, you must never approach it.
Sometimes, on a dark night, your shadow thrown by a streetlight will suddenly and startlingly overtake you.
Onix has a magnet in its brain. It acts as a compass so that this Pokémon does not lose direction while it is tunneling.
It stands above your pillow and trying to eat your dream through your nostrils.
Hypno holds a pendulum in its hand. The arcing movement and glitter of the pendulum lull the foe into a deep state of hypnosis.
Krabby live on beaches, burrowed inside holes dug into the sand.
Kingler has an enormous, oversized claw. It waves this huge claw in the air to communicate with others.
Voltorb was first sighted at a company that manufactures Poké Balls.
On days when lightning strikes, you can see this Pokémon exploding all over the place from eating too much electricity.
This Pokémon consists of six eggs that form a closely knit cluster.
Exeggutor originally came from the tropics. Its heads steadily grow larger from exposure to strong sunlight.
Cubone pines for the mother it will never see again. Seeing a likeness of its mother in the full moon, it cries.
Marowak is the evolved form of a Cubone that has overcome its sadness at the loss of its mother and grown tough.
Hitmonlee\'s legs freely contract and stretch. Using these springlike legs, it bowls over foes with devastating kicks.
Hitmonchan is said to possess the spirit of a boxer who had been working toward a world championship.
Whenever Lickitung comes across something new, it will unfailingly give it a lick.
If Koffing becomes agitated, it raises the toxicity of its internal gases and jets them out from all over its body.
Weezing loves the gases given off by rotted kitchen garbage. This Pokémon will find a dirty, unkempt house and make it its home.
Rhyhorn runs in a straight line, smashing everything in its path.
Rhydon\'s horn can crush even uncut diamonds. One sweeping blow of its tail can topple a building.
Chansey lays nutritionally excellent eggs on an everyday basis.
Tangela\'s vines snap off easily if they are grabbed. This happens without pain, allowing it to make a quick getaway.
If you come across a young Kangaskhan playing by itself, you must never disturb it or attempt to catch it.
This Pokémon anchors itself by wrapping its tail around rocks or coral to prevent being washed away.
Seadra sleeps after wriggling itself between the branches of coral.
Goldeen is a very beautiful Pokémon with fins that billow elegantly in water.
In the autumn, Seaking males can be seen performing courtship dances in riverbeds to woo females.
Staryu\'s center section has an organ called the core that shines bright red.
Starmie\'s center sectionthe coreglows brightly in seven colors.
Its gestures and motions convince watchers that something unseeable actually exists.
Scyther is blindingly fast. Its blazing speed enhances the effectiveness of the twin scythes on its forearms.
Jynx walks rhythmically, swaying and shaking its hips as if it were dancing.
When a storm arrives, gangs of this Pokémon compete with each other to scale heights that are likely to be stricken by lightning bolts.
In battle, Magmar blows out intensely hot flames from all over its body to intimidate its opponent.
Pinsir is astoundingly strong. It can grip a foe weighing twice its weight in its horns and easily lift it.
This Pokémon is not satisfied unless it is rampaging at all times.
Magikarp is a pathetic excuse for a Pokémon that is only capable of flopping and splashing.
When Magikarp evolves into Gyarados, its brain cells undergo a structural transformation.
In the evenings, this Pokémon is said to sing plaintively as it seeks what few others of its kind still remain.
Ditto rearranges its cell structure to transform itself into other shapes.
Eevee has an unstable genetic makeup that suddenly mutates due to the environment in which it lives.
Vaporeon underwent a spontaneous mutation and grew fins and gills that allow it to live underwater.
Jolteon\'s cells generate a low level of electricity. This power is amplified by the static electricity of its fur.
Flareon\'s fluffy fur has a functional purposeit releases heat into the air so that its body does not get excessively hot.
Porygon is capable of reverting itself entirely back to program data and entering cyberspace.
Omanyte is one of the ancient and long-since-extinct Pokémon that have been regenerated from fossils by people.
It is believed to have become extinct because its shell grew too large and heavy.
Kabuto is a Pokémon that has been regenerated from a fossil.
Kabutops swam underwater to hunt for its prey in ancient times.
Aerodactyl is a Pokémon from the age of dinosaurs. It was regenerated from genetic material extracted from amber.
Snorlax\'s typical day consists of nothing more than eating and sleeping.
Articuno is a legendary bird Pokémon that can control ice. The flapping of its wings chills the air.
Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon that has the ability to control electricity. It usually lives in thunderclouds.
Moltres is a legendary bird Pokémon that has the ability to control fire.
Dratini continually molts and sloughs off its old skin.
Dragonair stores an enormous amount of energy inside its body. It is said to alter weather conditions .
Dragonite is capable of circling the globe in just 16 hours. It is a kindhearted Pokémon.
Mewtwo is a Pokémon that was created by genetic manipulation.It killed its creators.
